str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Of Latin origin; happy; Phelix, a Roman.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular

str2: From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A way, road, journey, path. Apparently a primary word; a road; by implication, a progress; figuratively, a mode or means.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To postpone, defer, especially: I postpone the trial of. Middle voice from ana and ballo; to put off.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.
Claudius Lysias, a Roman tribune of the soldiers in Jerusalem. Of uncertain affinity; Lysias, a Roman.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A commander of a thousand men, a military tribune. From chilioi and archo; the commander of a thousand soldiers

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go down, come down, either from the sky or from higher land, descend. From kata and the base of basis; to descend.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 1st Person Singular
str2: To know accurately, examine, decide. From dia and ginosko; to know thoroughly, i.e. Ascertain exactly.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
